parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.27

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Map

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Clear map animation.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''mapAnimClear'''

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[mapAnimClear]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[mapAnimAdd]], [[mapAnimCommit]], [[mapAnimDone]], [[ctrlMapAnimAdd]], [[ctrlMapAnimClear]], [[ctrlMapAnimCommit]], [[ctrlMapAnimDone]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', the mapAnim series of commands, together with [[forceMap]] can only be used in the intro and mission, as it is not possible to access the map from the outro. ''(not checked, sourced from an old copy of the OFPEC comref)''
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
